summary: David Marwell was involved with the JFK Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). He is mentioned in documents related to the CIA's review of JFK assassination records, security clearances for ARRB members, and requests for additional information from the CIA. A memo from John Pereira to David Marwell discusses the sensitivity of releasing information about joint US-Mexican telephone tap operations in Mexico City. He appears to have been a point of contact or recipient of information related to the ARRB's work and CIA concerns regarding the release of sensitive information. He was involved in discussions regarding the release of CIA employees' names in JFK records and the protection of sensitive information.
key_connections: House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence (HPSCI)
significance: David Marwell's significance in the JFK context lies in his involvement with the ARRB and his role in handling sensitive information and requests related to the JFK assassination records. He appears to have been a key figure in the communication and coordination between the ARRB and the CIA, particularly regarding the declassification and release of information.
